channel.title: [PI] Adding Cash Command [PI]
channel.description:
I have no idea how to add commands because ive never tried ive asked but forgot about it
Can someone give me a cash command? and tell me how to put it in
from my coding id think it should be like somethingequals yada yada and addItem; 995, 500000000 or something like that
maybe mopar should have a questions topic for just any kind of question

item.title: [PI] Adding Cash Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“hadesflames, post:6, topic:394459”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=491645.msg3595275#msg3595275 date=1305006160]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=491645.msg3595274#msg3595274 date=1305006093]

You might have too modify it, as this is how I’m familiar with for 562 :P. But it should be easy too modify

if(cmd[0].equals("cash")) player.getInventory().addItem(995, 300000000);

Where to put it… I have no idea, but it currently add’s 300M too the players inventory who does it :P. Someone will reply though fast about this >.<. :rolleyes:
[/quote]Close

if (playerCommand.equals("cash")) { c.getPA().additems(995,50000000); }
[/quote]Both of those are equivalent since there’s only one statement in the command.

Yes but his code would not have worked on a 317 PI. Look closer at the statements.

Also, for me it’s

c.getItems().addItem(id, amount);[/quote]my mistake i do believe it is getItems…been a while not using PI a whole lot.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding Cash Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @oldskoolpk oldskoolpk
item.description:
@oldskoolpk wrote:

if (playerCommand.equals(“cash”)) { c.getPA().additems(995,50000000); }

copy and paste that right after the last “}”

In commands.java

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding Cash Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:7, topic:394459”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=491645.msg3595277#msg3595277 date=1305006284]

[quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=491645.msg3595275#msg3595275 date=1305006160]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=491645.msg3595274#msg3595274 date=1305006093]

You might have too modify it, as this is how I’m familiar with for 562 :P. But it should be easy too modify

if(cmd[0].equals("cash")) player.getInventory().addItem(995, 300000000);

Where to put it… I have no idea, but it currently add’s 300M too the players inventory who does it :P. Someone will reply though fast about this >.<. :rolleyes:
[/quote]Close

if (playerCommand.equals("cash")) { c.getPA().additems(995,50000000); }
[/quote]Both of those are equivalent since there’s only one statement in the command.

Yes but his code would not have worked on a 317 PI. Look closer at the statements.

Also, for me it’s

c.getItems().addItem(id, amount);
[/quote]I don’t code RSPS sources. I’m talking with general Java syntax, both would work the exact same way.[/quote]

Both would be compiled the same sure, but they are different. As a matter of fact, the other one would throw errors because the variables/methods being used/called don’t exist.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Adding Cash Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

ok so ive tried both and idk how to add under this

[code] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”)) {
for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) {
c.playerLevel[i] = 99;
c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}

}

public void DonatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)
{

}
}
[/code]

do i put like 1 “enter” or more maybe 1-3 tabs idk

Read full topic

You might have too modify it, as this is how I’m familiar with for 562 :P. But it should be easy too modify

Where to put it… I have no idea, but it currently add’s 300M too the players inventory who does it :P. Someone will reply though fast about this >.<. :rolleyes:
[/quote]Close

if (playerCommand.equals("cash")) { c.getPA().additems(995,50000000); }
[/quote]Both of those are equivalent since there’s only one statement in the command.

Yes but his code would not have worked on a 317 PI. Look closer at the statements.

Also, for me it’s

c.getItems().addItem(id, amount);[/quote]I don’t code RSPS sources. I’m talking with general Java syntax, both would work the exact same way.
